qas.question: What is the most popular icon of Mexico City?
Who made the Angel of Independence?

answers.text: the order of the Emperor Maximilian

qas.question: The angel of independence is over the roadway that connects what?

answers.text: National Palace (seat of government) with the Castle of Chapultepec

qas.question: How long is the longest avenue in Mexico City?
What is the name of the longest avenue in Mexico City?

context: The most recognizable icon of Mexico City is the <a0_0>golden Angel of Independence<a0_0/> on the wide, elegant avenue Paseo de la Reforma, modeled by <a1_0>the order of the Emperor Maximilian<a1_0/> of Mexico after the Champs-Élysées in Paris. This avenue was designed over the Americas' oldest known major roadway in the 19th century to connect the <a2_0>National Palace (seat of government) with the Castle of Chapultepec<a2_0/>, the imperial residence. Today, this avenue is an important financial district in which the Mexican Stock Exchange and several corporate headquarters are located. Another important avenue is the <a4_0>Avenida de los Insurgentes<a4_0/>, which extends <a3_0>28.8 km (17.9 mi)<a3_0/> and is one of the longest single avenues in the world.
